reviewText: With so much "junk" being released, why is it the truly GREAT shows seem to take forever to be released. OK, we finally got Ally McBeal. And it was packaged wonderfully, with a few great special features. But American Dreams??? It has not been forgotten, and with a tiny bit of promotion it could be a huge seller. The T.A.M.I. show finally came out to rave reviews, and where is NYPD Blue seasons 5 and beyond. One of the most popular shows ever!!! None of these great series ever made it into syndication, and if I remember American Dreams kept getting pre-empted for Sunday football, etc. and difficult to follow with several weeks of interuptions. I love watching a box set over 2 or 3 days, and really get into the story. Bring out the good stuff to DVD, I dont need it on BluRay 3D but I would like to see it again while I am still alive. When I purchase a box set from a TV series, it is with the expectation that the rest of the series will be made available in a reasonable time frame. I am still waiting for any news on the release of:Fame season 3 +American Dreams season 2 +NYPD Blue season 5 +Make It or Break It season 1 part 2 +Why is it so difficult for the studios to at least give us an estimate on a release date?Some of these series are offered from distributors in Korea, and at lower prices, but I have no idea if they are legal, or of good quality, and they seldom have any of the special bonus features we fans love to have included with our favorite shows. I also want to support the legal copyright owners. But they make it very difficult when they do not show us the courtesy of an estimated release date, or even IF our favorite series will EVER be released to DVD. Very frustrating!!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: What a great show this is.  Echoing what others here have said.  I did not catch it on TV, and was so excited to rent the DVD's and ultimately bought them.  But now, it has been 4 years plus, and am waiting (not too patiently!) for the rest of the series!  The show is so much FUN, as well as heartwarming.  Actually, blu-ray would be even better - but at this point I'll take whatever I can get!
Title: N/A

reviewText: American Dreams was one of the best TV shows ever -- and I echo the other reviewers, and no doubt countless others who haven't taken the time to write a review here, in pleading that the rest of the series be released on DVD.  Forget reality TV (I know it's cheap because you don't have to pay actors) and the other garbage on network and even cable TV.  If we want to have a better society, we need to have more shows like American Dreams that stir people to think, to appreciate the complexity of real reality, and...to "dream" into being a more emotionally mature and noble world.
summary: ONE OF THE BEST TV SHOWS EVER!!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: In agreement with all. I just watched "The T.A.M.I Show" which I received from Netflix, and I have a hankering for more 60s goodness!  I have season 1 of American Dreams and its kind of painful to be left hanging on for so long to find out what happens next. I really wish (idealistic thinking here) that these corporations would get over themselves and pay the money, royalties or whatever for the music on these shows and go ahead and release them to the public on DVD.  How about thinking of all the people you will make happy and who will finally have something decent to watch, instead of the almighty dollar. Wishful thinking of course!
Title: N/A
